node.title: Building a Backtest Trading App with Flask
node.description: Tired of manually backtesting trading strategies, I built a web app to automate the process, allowing for extensive testing and parameter adjustments.
node.content:
Backtesting my trading strategies manually was tedious and time-consuming. Staring at TradingView's charts, I'd painstakingly identify buying and selling points, adjusting stop loss and take profit for each position.

Seeking Automation

Realizing the need for efficiency, I embarked on creating a web app to automate backtesting. This proved invaluable for testing over extended periods and experimenting with various risk-reward ratios and stop loss distances.

Crafting the Strategy

Utilizing indicators like MACD, 200 EMA, and Average True Range (ATR), I crafted a robust trading strategy. The web app facilitated easy parameter adjustments, enabling extensive testing and exploration of different parameter combinations.

Drawing Conclusions

Through rigorous testing, I gained insights into the strategy's long-term potential returns. While past results don't guarantee future success, having a profitable strategy instills confidence in trading decisions, even amid losses.

Embracing Discipline

Understanding that losses are part of the game, I emphasized the importance of discipline in sticking to the strategy. Armed with a well-tested approach, I approached trading with a sense of assurance and resilience.
